region_description: Quebec City, a UNESCO World Heritage site, is known for its well-preserved historic architecture and vibrant French-speaking culture. Nestled along the St. Lawrence River, this charming city boasts cobblestone streets, fortified walls, and stunning views from the iconic Château Frontenac. Visitors can explore the Old Quebec district, a lively area filled with boutiques, cafés, and historic sites. The city is rich in history, with influences from both French and British cultures. Quebec City offers a unique blend of old-world charm and modern attractions, making it a captivating destination for travelers.

places_to_visit.name: Old Quebec
places_to_visit.description: A historic district filled with narrow streets, shops, and cafés, showcasing the city's French heritage.

places_to_visit.name: Château Frontenac
places_to_visit.description: An iconic hotel that dominates the skyline, offering guided tours and breathtaking views of the city.

places_to_visit.name: Montmorency Falls
places_to_visit.description: A stunning waterfall that is higher than Niagara Falls, accessible by trails and bridges.

places_to_visit.name: Plains of Abraham
places_to_visit.description: A historic park where a major battle took place, now a popular spot for picnics and outdoor activities.

hotels.name: Fairmont Le Château Frontenac
hotels.description: A luxurious and historic hotel located in Old Quebec, offering elegant accommodations and fine dining.

hotels.name: Hotel Le Concorde Quebec
hotels.description: A modern hotel with comfortable rooms and a great location near the historic district.

restaurants.name: Le Continental
restaurants.description: A classic French restaurant known for its exceptional cuisine and romantic ambiance.

restaurants.name: La Bûche
restaurants.description: A rustic eatery serving traditional Quebecois dishes in a cozy setting, perfect for tasting local flavors.
